REPORT.Retrospective Effect of the Pensions (Increase) Bill.In pursuance of the Third Conclusion of the fourth Report of the Emergency Business Committee (CP. 471(23)) the Chancellor of the Exchequer has been consulted with regard to tho suggested publication of the decision to give retrospective effect to the proposed Pensions (Increase) Bill, and it has been agreed that the announcement of the decision should take the following form:-"In the event of the Government returning to power, they will, as they have already promised, introduoe a Bill at the earliest possible opportunity for amending the Pensions (Increase) Act, 1920 on the lines of the Measure promised in the recent Session, and should the Bill be passed, as is anticipated, next Session, they will arrange that pensioners shall not be prejudiced by the delay which has been caused by the Election."(Signed) R.B. HOtfORTH, Secretary,to the Committee.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.tf.1., 29th November, 192S.
